briefdescription.para: Executive Services Exception/Reset Log Type.

detaileddescription.para: Executive Services Exception/Reset Log File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_ES_WriteERLog2File command.

briefdescription.para: Executive Services System Log Type.

detaileddescription.para: Executive Services System Log File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_ES_WriteSysLog2File command.

briefdescription.para: Executive Services Information on All Applications File.

detaileddescription.para: Executive Services Information on All Applications File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_ES_WriteAppInfo2File command.

briefdescription.para: Executive Services Performance Data File.

detaileddescription.para: Executive Services Performance Analyzer Data File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_ES_StopLAData command.

briefdescription.para: Executive Services Shell Response File.

detaileddescription.para: Executive Services Shell Response Data File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu$_ES_Shell command.

briefdescription.para: Executive Services Critical Data Store Registry Dump File.

detaileddescription.para: Executive Services Critical Data Store Registry Dump File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_ES_WriteCDS2File command.
Table Services Registry Dump File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_TBL_WriteReg2File command.

briefdescription.para: Table Services Table Image File.

detaileddescription.para: Table Services Table Image File which is generated either on the ground or in response to a $sc_$cpu_TBL_DUMP command.

briefdescription.para: Event Services Application Data Dump File.

detaileddescription.para: Event Services Application Data Dump File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_EVS_WriteAppData2File command.

detaileddescription.para: Event Services Local Event Log Dump File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_EVS_WriteLog2File command.

detaileddescription.para: Software Bus Pipe Data Dump File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_SB_WritePipe2File command.

briefdescription.para: Software Bus Message Routing Data Dump File.

detaileddescription.para: Software Bus Message Routing Data Dump File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_SB_WriteRouting2File command.

briefdescription.para: Software Bus Message Mapping Data Dump File.

detaileddescription.para: Software Bus Message Mapping Data Dump File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_SB_WriteMap2File command.

briefdescription.para: Executive Services Query All Tasks Data File.

detaileddescription.para: Executive Services Query All Tasks Data File which is generated in response to a $sc_$cpu_ES_WriteTaskInfo2File command.

briefdescription.para: Max length of description field in a standard cFE File Header.
Magic Number for cFE compliant files (= 'cFE1')
Read the contents of the Standard cFE File Header.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API will fill the specified CFE_FS_Header_t variable with the contents of the Standard cFE File Header of the file identified by the given File Descriptor.

listitem.para: The File has already been successfully opened using OS_open and the caller has a legitimate File Descriptor.

parameterdescription.para: File Descriptor obtained from a previous call to OS_open that is associated with the file whose header is to be read.
Pointer to a variable of type CFE_FS_Header_t that will be filled with the contents of the Standard cFE File Header.
Contents of the Standard cFE File Header for the specified file.

entry.para: Any of the return codes specified for OS_lseek or OS_read

briefdescription.para: Initializes the contents of the Standard cFE File Header.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API will clear the specified CFE_FS_Header_t variable and initialize the description field with the specified value

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a variable of type CFE_FS_Header_t that will be cleared and initialized

briefdescription.para: Write the specified Standard cFE File Header to the specified file.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API will output the specified CFE_FS_Header_t variable, with some fields automatically updated, to the specified file as the Standard cFE File Header. This API will automatically populate the following fields in the specified CFE_FS_Header_t:

listitem.para: SpacecraftID - Filled with the Spacecraft ID
ProcessorID - Filled with the Processor ID
ApplicationID - Filled with the Application ID
TimeSeconds - Filled with the Time, in seconds, as obtained by CFE_TIME_GetTime
TimeSubSeconds - Filled with the Time, subseconds, as obtained by CFE_TIME_GetTime
The File has already been successfully opened using OS_open and the caller has a legitimate File Descriptor.
The SubType field has been filled appropriately by the Application.
The Description field has been filled appropriately by the Application.

parameterdescription.para: File Descriptor obtained from a previous call to OS_open that is associated with the file whose header is to be read.
Pointer to a variable of type CFE_FS_Header_t that will be filled with the contents of the Standard cFE File Header.
Contents of the Standard cFE File Header for the specified file.

entry.para: Any of the return codes specified for OS_lseek or OS_write

briefdescription.para: Modifies the Time Stamp field in the Standard cFE File Header for the specified file.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API will modify the timestamp found in the Standard cFE File Header of the specified file. The timestamp will be replaced with the time specified by the caller.

listitem.para: The File has already been successfully opened using OS_open and the caller has a legitimate File Descriptor.
The NewTimestamp field has been filled appropriately by the Application.

parameterdescription.para: File Descriptor obtained from a previous call to OS_open that is associated with the file whose header is to be read.
A CFE_TIME_SysTime_t data structure containing the desired time to be put into the file's Standard cFE File Header.

entry.para: Any of the return codes specified for OS_lseek or OS_write

briefdescription.para: Determines if a file is a Gzip/compressed file.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API will check the filename and return TRUE if the file is a gzip file. The check is currently based on the filename, so the zipped files should use the ".gz" extention.

listitem.para: A gzipped file will use the ".gz" filename extention.

entry.para: TRUE if the file has the ".gz" extention and FALSE otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Extracts the filename from a unix style path and filename string.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API will take the original unix path/filename combination and extract the base filename. Example: Given the path/filename : "/cf/apps/myapp.o.gz" this function will return the filename: "myapp.o.gz".

listitem.para: The paths and filenames used here are the standard unix style filenames separated by "/" characters.
The extracted filename is no longer than #OS_MAX_PATH_LEN

parameterdescription.para: The filename that is extracted from the path.

entry.para: CFE_SUCCESS if the filename was extracted from the path

briefdescription.para: Decompresses the source file to the destination file.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API will decompress the source file to the file specified by the destination file. The file must be compressed using the "gzip" utility. This utility is available on most unix workstations, Mac OS X, Cygwin, and MinGW for Windows. More information can be found at http://www.gzip.org/

listitem.para: The paths and filenames used here are cfe compliant file names.
The source file is compressed with the "gzip" utility.
The destination file does not exist, or can be overwritten.

parameterdescription.para: The path/filename to write the decompressed or "gunzipped" file to.

entry.para: CFE_SUCCESS if the file was decompressed sucessfully.
